void mmwavelib_mattrans (const float32_t *restrict x, const int32_t rows, const int32_t cols, float32_t *restrict y)
 This function transposes the matrix x[] and writes the result to matrix y[]. It is the DSPLIB function DSPF_sp_mat_trans modified by only swapping rows to the inner loop and cols to the outer loop in the function, in order to be cycles efficient for matrix with rows larger than columns. More...
 

Detailed Description

Matrix utility functions.

Function Documentation

void mmwavelib_mattrans ( const float32_t *restrict  x,
const int32_t  rows,
const int32_t  cols,
float32_t *restrict  y 
)

This function transposes the matrix x[] and writes the result to matrix y[]. It is the DSPLIB function DSPF_sp_mat_trans modified by only swapping rows to the inner loop and cols to the outer loop in the function, in order to be cycles efficient for matrix with rows larger than columns.

Parameters
[in]x: Input matrix containing rows*cols 32bit floating-point numbers.
[in]rows: Number of rows in matrix x. Also number of columns in matrix y.
[in]cols: Number of columns in matrix x. Also number of rows in matrix y.
[out]y: Output matrix containing cols*rows 32bit floating-point numbers.
Returns
void
Precondition
(1)x and y are 8 byte aligned, and do not overlap.
(2)rows and cols are multiple of 2, and >=2.

Cycles 0.75*rows*cols + 3*cols + 35 (cols <=6) 1*rows*cols + 3*cols + 35 (cols >=8) (cgt 8.1.3)
